intro: Tetrameris versicolor, commonly known as the variable tetrameris, is a flowering plant species native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, colorful flowers that vary in hue, hence its common name. It typically grows in moist, tropical environments and is often found in shaded undergrowth. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it produces capsules as its fruit type.
